text: Parliamentary elections were held in Laos on 25 December 1955.Dieter Nohlen, Florian Grotz & Christof Hartmann (2001) Elections in Asia: A data handbook, Volume II, p135 The result was a victory for the ruling National Progressive Party, which won 22 of the 39 seats.Nohlen et al., p137 Voter turnout was 75.6%. ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Party !Votes !% !Seats !+/– |- |align=left|National Progressive Party|| || ||22||+3 |- |align=left|Independent Party|| || ||7||–3 |- |align=left|Democratic Party|| || ||3||–1 |- |align=left|Lao National Union Party|| || ||2||0 |- |align=left|Independents|| || ||5||+1 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes|| ||–||–||– |- |align=left|Total||227,841|| ||39||0 |- |colspan=5 align=left|Source: Nohlen et al. |} ==References== Category:1955 elections in Asia Category:Elections in Laos Category:1955 in Laos
title: 1955 Laotian parliamentary election
